newsitem.title: GERMANY: Siemens takes over German hydraulics group.
newsitem.headline: Siemens takes over German hydraulics group.

text.p: German industrial group Siemens AG said on Thursday its automotive systems unit would acquire 80 percent of Hydraulik-Ring Beteiligungs GmbH, a maker of hydraulic systems.

Siemens said the two expected to make capital investments of more than 50 million marks and planned to have its new partner manufacture high-pressure injection systems that could be used in cars and trains.
Hydrualik-Ring in 1996 had sales of 80 million marks and employed 280 workers. Its results last year were "balanced" despite technology investments and restructuring costs, Siemens said.
Hydraulik-Ring holds more than 80 patents related to valves for drives, motors, gearboxes, and steering units.
In the six months that ended March 31, Siemens Automotive Systems' sales rose 15 percent to 2.2 billion marks. The unit employs 15,000 workers worldwide.
